conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions—I'm Student_E. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the possibility of joining your community. I’m ready to commit if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D), so applying immediately risks rejection if higher-priority students apply this round. In contrast, School_A ranks me 1st, and School_A is my 3rd choice—still very good. Locking in School_A now is the safest way to secure a high placement rather than gamble on School_C and potentially fall further. Therefore I will apply to School_A immediately.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and can secure our top choice immediately. Although Student_B also applied and ranks School_A first, Student_B is lower priority (#4) for us. Accepting Student_E now maximizes our outcome and avoids risk of losing them to other schools where they may also be competitive.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_B and School_A is my first choice. I’m very excited about the academic environment and would be committed to enrolling if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

Student_B is lower on our priority list than Student_E anyway, so there is no incentive or ability to accept.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_D. School_B is my first choice, and I’m applying because I’m highly committed to enrolling if accepted.
